Mike_Walker_(singer):
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Mike Walker | image = | caption = | image_size = | birth_name = Michael Aubrey Walker{{cite web | url=https://repertoire.bmi.com/Search/Catalog?num=bsu9NQDuQL6ck3QFOJIOaA%253d%253d&cae=YmUbMnyKbQkfNzXLZ%252fbLAQ%253d%253d&partType=WriterList&search=%7B%22Main_Search_Text%22%3A%22If%20There%5Cu0027s%20a%20Chance%20to%20Say%20I%20Love%20You%22%2C%22Sub_Search_Text%22%3Anull%2C%22Main_Search%22%3A%22Title%22%2C%22Sub_Search%22%3Anull%2C%22Search_Type%22%3A%22all%22%2C%22View_Count%22%3A100%2C%22Page_Number%22%3A0%2C%22Part_Type%22%3Anull%2C%22Part_Id%22%3Anull%2C%22Part_Id_Sub%22%3Anull%2C%22Part_Name%22%3Anull%2C%22Part_Cae%22%3Anull%2C%22Original_Search%22%3Anull%2C%22DisclaimerViewed%22%3Anull%7D&resetPageNumber=True&partIdSub=YO0HedHMatLb45JzS23DVw%253d%253d | title=Search results for Michael Aubrey Walker | publisher=BMI | accessdate=June 26, 2022}} | origin = [[Jackson, Tennessee]], U.S.{{cite web |url=http://countrymusic.about.com/library/blmikewalkerbio.htm |title=Mike Walker biography |accessdate=2009-02-05 |work=[[About.com]]}} | instrument = Vocals, Guitar | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer, songwriter | years_active = 1998-present | label = [[DreamWorks Nashville]] | associated_acts = }} '''Michael Aubrey Walker''' is an American [[country music]] artist. In 2000 he was signed by [[DreamWorks Nashville]] and in 2001, he released his self-titled debut album. This album produced his only chart single in "Honey Do", which peaked at number 42 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' country charts. He also toured with [[Brooks & Dunn]] on the first annual "Neon Circus Tour" which also featured [[Toby Keith]], [[Montgomery Gentry]], [[Keith Urban]] and [[Cledus T. Judd]] after the release of his album, although its second through fifth singles all failed to chart. Included on the album were covers of [[Rodney Crowell]]'s 1990 single "[[What Kind of Love]]", [[Billy "Crash" Craddock]]'s 1974 single "[[Rub It In]]", and [[T. Graham Brown]]'s 1999 single "Memphis Women and Chicken". [[Gary Allan]] also recorded the song "See If I Care" on his album of the [[See If I Care (Gary Allan album)|same name]], and "Honey Do" was originally recorded by [[Keith Harling]] on his 1999 album ''[[Bring It On (Keith Harling album)|Bring It On]]''. In the late 2000s, Walker began performing in [[Branson, Missouri]]. ==''Mike Walker'' (2001)== {{Infobox album | italic_title = no | name = Mike Walker | type = studio | artist = Mike Walker | cover = | alt = | released = {{Start date|2001|10|09}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = Country | length = | label = DreamWorks Nashville | producer = [[James Stroud]]
